page.title: 12Church of Scotland
page.content: The church was erected in{1885}by {Caroline Stuart, Countess of Seafield in memory of her husband and son, the 7th and 8th Earl of Seafield who died within three months of each other. Originally it was called{Inverallan {Church,}but when it{combined}with the {South Church}it served the new parish of Grantown on Spey and therefore became{Grantown on Spey Church of {Scotland. It seats 1000 people but unfortunately Grantown does not have a reputation of being keen churchgoers and there are seldom this many in church. At a funeral recently, 1100 people packed the church to mourn. The present minister is{Rev. Colin {Alston.
